BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. Main problem at high altitudes: snowdrift accumulations. Isolated danger zones occur in steep ridgeline terrain on N/E/S facing sloeps and in wind-loaded gullies and bowls. Small slabs can be triggered by 1 person. The danger of falling generally outweighs that of being buried in snow. In addition, in extremely steep terrain at intermediate altitudes, wet loose-snow avalanches can trigger naturally wherever there is sufficient snow on the ground, mostly small releases.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: At high altitudes, snowdrift accumulations are now covered by fresh fallen snow, these can be trigger-prone. Otherwise the bonding of fresh snow to the moist or melt-freeze encrusted surface is mostly good. The old snowpack at intermediate altitudes is often thoroughly wet. In case of solar radiation the fresh snow loses its firmness in steep rocky terrain and can begin to glide away.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Due to rising temperatures, the wet-snow problem will come to the forefront in the next few days.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Snowdrifts now blanketed by fresh snow
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger in the Allgäu is moderate above the treeline, below that altitude danger is low. Main problem: snowdrift accumulations. Isolated danger zones occur in steep ridgeline terrain on N/E/S facing sloeps and in wind-loaded gullies and bowls. Small slabs can be triggered by 1 person. The danger of falling generally outweighs that of being buried in snow. In addition, in extremely steep terrain at intermediate altitudes, wet loose-snow avalanches can trigger naturally wherever there is sufficient snow on the ground, mostly small releases. Especially in sunny, rocky steep terrain, the fresh snow can trigger naturally as a small loose-snow avalanche during the course of the day.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: At high altitudes, snowdrift accumulations are now covered by fresh fallen snow, these can be trigger-prone. The snowdrift accumulations in wind-protected terrain are prone to triggering. Inside the snowdrifts, weak layers can lurk. Otherwise the bonding of fresh snow to the moist or melt-freeze encrusted surface is mostly good. The old snowpack at intermediate altitudes is often thoroughly wet. In case of solar radiation the fresh snow loses its firmness in steep rocky terrain and can begin to glide away.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Due to rising temperatures, the wet-snow problem will come to the forefront in the next few days.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Snowdrifts now blanketed by fresh snow
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger in the Berchtesgaden Alps above 2000 m is moderate, below that altitude danger is low. Main problem: snowdrift accumulations. Isolated danger zones occur in steep ridgeline terrain on N/E/S facing sloeps and in wind-loaded gullies and bowls. Small slabs can be triggered by 1 person. The danger of falling generally outweighs that of being buried in snow. In addition, in extremely steep terrain at intermediate altitudes, wet loose-snow avalanches can trigger naturally wherever there is sufficient snow on the ground, mostly small releases.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: At high altitudes, snowdrift accumulations are now covered by fresh fallen snow, these can be trigger-prone. Otherwise the bonding of fresh snow to the moist or melt-freeze encrusted surface is mostly good. The old snowpack at intermediate altitudes is often thoroughly wet. In case of solar radiation the fresh snow loses its firmness in steep rocky terrain and can begin to glide away.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Due to rising temperatures, the wet-snow problem will come to the forefront in the next few days.
